text: Scirpophaga gotoi is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Angoon Lewvanich in 1981. It is found in the Chinese provinces of Jiangsu and Guangdong and in Japan. The wingspan is 23–24 mm for males and 26–30 mm for females. The forewings are shining ochreous yellow with a dark fuscous spot at the lower angle of the cell. The hindwings are ochreous yellow. Females have an ochreous-yellow anal tuft. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1981 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of China Category:Moths of Japan
title: Scirpophaga gotoi
